Internet service providers (ISPs) must maintain internet neutrality in order to give customers access to a range of legal content, applications, and services. This means that no single entity controls the content or transmission aspects of the Internet; all users have equal access to resources regardless of their provider. ISPs must also treat all data equally, preventing the prioritization of certain content or application traffic over others.
